Class World

java.lang.Object
edu.southalabama.csc527.smallworld.model.World
public final class World extends Object
The simulated world in which simulated players lead their short, simulated lives. In the Model/View/Controller paradigm, this is the model. It is an aggregate that contains everything that exists in the world. It also acts as the subject in the Observer pattern, so that observers (e.g., views) can stay current when the world changes in some interesting way.

A newly constructed world contains a Player and a nowhere Place. The player is located at the nowhere place. The world, via method calls, may then be mutated into something more interesting. This approach ensures that even a newly constructed world is trivially playable.

  • Field Details

    • LINESEP

      public static String LINESEP
      A String holding the operating system-specific line separator obtained from the system properties.

  • Constructor Details

    • World

      public World()
      Constructs a new instance of the world class containing a single player and the nowhere place. The player is located at the nowhere place.
      See Also:
      • getNowherePlace()

  • Method Details

    • getNowherePlace

      public Place getNowherePlace()
      Gets the Place representing nowhere. This place always exists in every world.
      Returns:
      the place representing nowhere.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Gets a reference to the sole player interacting with this world.
      Returns:
      the sole player within this world.

    • isNameUsed

      public boolean isNameUsed(String name)
      Returns true if the specified name is used for a Place within this world, false otherwise. Names are non-case sensitive, so "NAME" is considered the same name as "nAmE". In addition, the namespace of the world is shared across all Place instances.
      Parameters:
      name - the non-null non-case sensitive name to check.
      Returns:
      true if the specified name is used for a Place within this world, false otherwise.

    • getPlaceByName

      public Place getPlaceByName(String name)
      Gets the appropriate Place instance with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - the non-null non-case sensitive name of the desired Place instance.
      Returns:
      the appropriate Place instance, or null if the specified name does not exist.

    • getPlaces

      public Set<Place> getPlaces()
      Returns a copy of all the Places in this world.
      Returns:
      a copy of the set of all Places in this world.

    • getPlace

      public Place getPlace(String name)
      Gets the appropriate Place instance with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - the non-null non-case sensitive name of the desired Place instance.
      Returns:
      the appropriate Place instance, or null if the specified name does not exist or is not of the Place type.

    • createPlace

      public Place createPlace(String name, String article, String description)
      Constructs a new place within this world.
      Parameters:
      name - a non-null unique name for the instance. The uniqueness of the name can't be dependent upon case, e.g., "Hall" is considered the same as "hall".
      article - the appropriate non-null indefinite article with which to prefix the name so as to form a proper short description, e.g., "the" or "a".
      description - a long, possibly mult-line, non-null description of this thing.
      Returns:
      the new Place instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the specified name already exists within this world.

    • getMessage

      public String getMessage()
      Returns the current message associated with this world.
      Returns:
      The world's current message.

    • setMessage

      public void setMessage(String message)
      Sets the current message associated with this world to the specified message. Any previous contents are lost.
      Parameters:
      message - a message.

    • addToMessage

      public void addToMessage(String message)
      Appends a message to the world's current message.
      Parameters:
      message - The new message to add to the world's current message.

    • addToMessage

      public void addToMessage()
      Appends a blank line to the world's current message.

    • getObservers

      public Set<IWorldObserver> getObservers()
      Gets a copy of the set of all observers of this world.
      Returns:
      a copy of the set of all observers of this world.

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver(IWorldObserver observer)
      Adds an observer to be notified when the world has changed in some interesting way.
      Parameters:
      observer - the object to notify of changes to this world.

    • removeObserver

      public void removeObserver(IWorldObserver observer)
      Removes an observer from this world. Has no effect if the specified observer was not previously added as an observer.
      Parameters:
      observer - the object to stop notifying of changes to this world.

    • turnOver

      public void turnOver()
      Directs that the player's current turn is complete and that an update notification should be sent to any observing views. This method erases the world's current message after view notification is completed.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Reports if the game is over or not.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise.

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver()
      Notifies this world that the game is over. Will cause all subsequent calls to isGameOver() to return true.
